name: Skilled Trades, Services & Physical
description: Providing essential services and craftsmanship through skilled trades and hands-on work.

subRoles.name: Electrician
subRoles.shortDescription: Installs, maintains, and repairs electrical systems in homes, businesses, and factories.
subRoles.longDescription: Electricians install and maintain electrical systems, including wiring, circuits, and electrical components in residential, commercial, and industrial settings. They read blueprints, follow safety regulations, and troubleshoot electrical problems.

typicalDay: Travel to job sites and review work orders
Install or repair electrical wiring and components
Test circuits and systems for safety and functionality
dailyLife.workEnvironment: Various locations including homes, offices, factories, outdoors
dailyLife.hours: 8-10 hours, may include evenings and weekends

subRoles.potential: Stable career with consistent demand. Opportunities for self-employment and business ownership. Physical work provides job satisfaction for hands-on individuals.

education.preferred: Trade school diploma or ITI certificate

subRoles.name: Plumber
subRoles.shortDescription: Installs and repairs piping systems for water, gas, and drainage.
subRoles.longDescription: Plumbers install and repair piping systems that carry water, gas, and waste in residential, commercial, and industrial buildings. They use various tools and equipment to ensure systems function properly and meet safety codes.

subRoles.name: Automotive Technician
subRoles.shortDescription: Diagnoses and repairs vehicles and automotive systems.
subRoles.longDescription: Automotive technicians diagnose, maintain, and repair cars and light trucks. They use computerized diagnostic equipment to identify problems and perform repairs on engines, transmissions, brakes, and other vehicle systems.
